--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, EmprzAnastazia@a... wrote:
> In a message dated 3/4/03 9:21:11 AM Central Standard Time, 
> cardhead649@y... writes:
> 
> 
> > > > "I betrayed him?"  Empath has to laugh.  "I suppose so, if 
you 
> > can 
> > > > say that about him keeping me under mind control for 300 
years 
> > before 
> > > > I broke free.  What good is loyalty to someone who would feed 
> > dozens 
> > > > of loyal followers to Unicron just to save his own miserable 
> > hide?  
> > > > Hydras only cares about himself.  He wants to rule the 
universe, 
> > and 
> > > > it doesn't matter to him what happens to anyone else along 
the 
> > way." 
> > > 
> > > She smirked. Only listening for now. 'typical' she thought. It 
was 
> > all too 
> > > familiar. 
> > >  
> > > > 
> > > > Empath digs a little further into Maxima's mind, bringing the 
> > memory 
> > > > of that kiss to the forefront.  "If you bought it, he'd only 
be 
> > upset 
> > > > because he lost his newest plaything.  He's using you, 
Maxima."
> > > > 
> > > 
> > > Stopping for a moment as she stared at Empath. "So much for 
> > technology. It's 
> > > not as good as the old Cybertronian technology we were once 
equiped 
> > with." 
> > > then she continued on walking beside Empath. "Obviously. But 
> > Galvatron did 
> > > that a lot as well, Empath." Glancing sideways as her. "Or did 
you 
> > forget 
> > > that already?" 
> > > 
> > > Continuing to walk in her feline state. "I've noticed much of 
> > Galvatron in 
> > > him. However, I'm like Megatron... I belong to no body. I have 
my 
> > own 
> > > objectives. Remember.. the only one I obey & will follow 
without 
> > question... 
> > > is Megatron." Her voice reflected the memories of the painful 
yet 
> > joyous 
> > > past. Then she laughed. "Besides," she smirked," I am not that 
easy 
> > to 
> > > destroy." Living this long, proved that. She always made it 
> > through, 
> > > surviving... until the next battle. "If Hydras has any of 
> > Megatron's 
> > > memories, then he should know me by now." pausing a 
> > moment. "Whatever 
> > > happened between Hydras & I... was a mere fabrication of ... 
> > organic 
> > > emotions. Which... I am immune to." she only looked ahead of 
> > her. "The 
> > > closest to such organic weaknesses that I have, is my loyalty 
to 
> > Megatron." 
> > > Pausing yet again. "In which I have nearly lost my own 
functioning 
> > ability 
> > > due to someone's foolish desire to depose him. I... getting in 
the 
> > way.. to 
> > > protect him... serve him..." she trailed off.. it was more like 
she 
> > was 
> > > muttering. Why she was 'pouring out her heart' to Empath was 
> > something she 
> > > never done. perhaps,.. it was this organic part of her. 
> > > 
> > > "Let him try to use me. He'll be greatly disappointed." She 
> > growled, sounding 
> > > just like she was in the old days at the beginning of the Great 
War.
> > 
> > Empath laughs.  "You're as immune to emotions as a wet iron bar 
is to 
> > rust," she taunts.  "You'll be sleeping with that egotistical 
> > scrapheap before you know it."
> > 
> 
> She cocked a brow & glanced at her. The statement was familiar 
until she 
> checked her data banks to know what it meant. Then she stopped & 
growled. 
> "Hardly!" Her claws digging into the ground. "I won't subject 
myself to 
> such... organic nonsense." She stepped over towards a bluff over 
looking a 
> tall cliff with a wide river below. 
> 
> Sitting down on the bluff, "Power before pleasure, Empath." then 
she glanced 
> back at the old Seeker, " Or have you forgotten all that?" She 
gazed at 
> Empath, sondering if she had become too soft, if being around 
animals & 
> Autobots has made her once hard Decepticon exocover as soft as the 
ground she 
> stood upon.

"Look who's talking; I didn't take time out from a mission to make 
out with my boyfriend," Empath snorts.  "In case you didn't notice, I 
didn't have too much trouble getting past Hydras's little defensive 
impant - would you like to find out just how much my power has 
increased?"  Maxima is treading on thin ice; at this close range, 
Empath could do just about anything she wants with her friend's 
neural circuitry.  "You fell for him like a brick, Maxima - there's 
no overriding your emotion chips anymore, like we used to before the 
Great Reformat."
